title: Recent Ping Increase with Shaw Communications
body:
Since yesterday me and all of my friends with Shaw have experienced an increase in ping to ~90ms where it used to be around ~30ms. We are all with Shaw and we all live in Winnipeg.

Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  router.asus.com [192.168.1.1] 
  2    12 ms     9 ms    11 ms  24.77.64.1 
  3    15 ms    10 ms    14 ms  rc3sc-be106-1.wp.shawcable.net [64.59.180.89] 
  4    32 ms    34 ms    28 ms  rc3so-be110-1.cg.shawcable.net [66.163.76.61] 
  5    52 ms    46 ms    49 ms  rc1wt-be82.wa.shawcable.net [66.163.76.9] 
  6    55 ms    52 ms    56 ms  six.zayo.com [206.81.80.19] 
  7    85 ms    84 ms    88 ms  208.185.240.194.IPYX-089814-ZYO.above.net [208.185.240.194] 
  8   169 ms   136 ms    88 ms  104.160.129.46 
  9    90 ms    93 ms    78 ms  ae30-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.10] 
 10   151 ms    88 ms    87 ms  104.160.131.101 
 11   150 ms    95 ms    83 ms  192.64.170.1 

Trace complete.

This is the results I got from a Tracert a couple of hours ago.

replies.body: I thought I was the only person experiencing this issue. Since 2 days ago, My ping increased to 90ms when I had a solid 30ms previously. I checked every network settings in case if the fault was due to me, but nope. It's either riot or Shaw

Based on this trace, it looks like your latency starts spiking after hitting shaw's node at
>**rc1wt-be82.wa.shawcable.net [66.163.76.9]**

____
Your latency then continues to rise as it transitions to Zayo's network, a backbone provider that Shaw partners with to get your connection to our servers. I strongly suggest reaching out to a tier 2 tech at Shaw while providing this trace so they can investigate.

Let me know if you have any other concerns.
This is also happening to me as well. I am on Shaw and I live in Vancouver. Just 2 days ago my ping was around 60, and for whatever reason, it went to 90. Please provide us with a solution :)
I live in B.C. and i'm having problems with Shaw too. Usually I get a constant 58-60 but now my ping is 86+ and it randomly spikes in games. This started happening a few days ago.
I'm having the exact same problems except I'm with Shaw in Alberta. Went from 50ish ping to 100. Spikes at 208.185.240.194 for me. Feelsbadman.

Riot doesn't care and is going to blame your ISP. Same thing happened with Rogers for months, then fixed itself for a couple weeks, and then again happened and is still happening.

How fast can you change your IP address (restart your router) when you get into game? This will usually force it to take a better route (for whatever fucking dumb reason). I can do it fast because I use an APN and have access to two APNs. If I wasn't on LTE I'd be fucked and unable to do that.
